_metadata.description: Complete well histories for all 7 portfolio wells demonstrating target data structure

wells._reference: See data/wells/M-21-complete.json for full M-21 dataset
wells.summary: HPHT Gas Condensate - Casing deformation remediated with expandable patch - 95% completeness

key_periods.comments: 92% capacity restoration, scale management program active

objectives: Remove severe BaSO4 scale accumulation from production tubing
Restore flow capacity without damaging completion
intervention_history.operations_summary: Coiled tubing intervention deploying DTPA chemical dissolver soaks followed by rotating jetting heads. Scale accumulation of 2-4 inches removed over 500 ft interval (1800-1950m MD). Multiple soak-and-jet cycles required due to scale hardness. Post-intervention flow testing confirmed 92% capacity restoration. Scale inhibitor squeeze program implemented.

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Attempted to advance through hardened scale section without sufficient chemical soak time
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Extended soak times (minimum 8 hours) for hardened BaSO4 scale before mechanical intervention

npt_breakdown.root_cause: High-pressure pump seal failure due to corrosive DTPA solution
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Use DTPA-rated seals, pre-job equipment inspection, backup pump on standby

npt_breakdown.root_cause: High seas prevented CT operations for 6 hours

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Rotating jetting heads essential for hardened BaSO4 scale removal - static jets insufficient
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Always use rotating jetting technology for scale hardness >8 Mohs, budget for extended operation time

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: DTPA chemical dissolvers highly effective for BaSO4 but require extended soak times (8-12 hours minimum)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Design intervention timeline with multiple soak cycles, avoid rushing mechanical intervention

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Combined chemical + mechanical approach delivers superior results vs either method alone (92% vs ~60% capacity restoration)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Integrated approach now mandatory for all severe scale interventions across portfolio

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Scale inhibitor squeeze program dramatically reduces recurrence risk and future NPT
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Proactive scale inhibitor squeeze now mandatory for all high-scale-risk wells (every 12 months)

intervention_history.operations_summary: Bullheading scale inhibitor (SI-2500 polymer-based) into near-wellbore formation. 850 gallons inhibitor + overflush. Squeeze pressure 4850 psi. Post-squeeze flowback and production monitoring confirms inhibitor placement and effectiveness.

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Proactive scale inhibitor squeeze eliminated future scale NPT - zero recurrence over 4 years
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: ROI excellent - $85k preventive spend avoids $420k reactive intervention. Continue 12-month squeeze cycle.

integrity_surveys.findings: Severe scale accumulation 2-4 inch thickness, 80% flow restriction at 1800-1950m MD
Scale successfully removed, tubing ID restored to 4.8 inch (original 5.0 inch)

metadata.notes: Demonstrates comprehensive scale management case study with reactive + preventive intervention data

scssv.failure_mode: Failed to close during function test
scssv.status: Failed - Locked open, replaced with insert valve

key_periods.comments: TRSSV failure - primary safety barrier compromised, well shut in
Insert valve restored primary barrier, production resumed

objectives: Deploy cost-effective alternative to TRSSV replacement
Eliminate flow obstruction from failed TRSSV
intervention_history.operations_summary: Failed TRSSV mechanically locked in open position using lock-open tool deployed via slickline. Slickline-retrievable insert safety valve installed 2m above failed TRSSV at 1448m MD. New valve successfully function-tested and certified as primary safety barrier per NSTA requirements. Total intervention time: 8 days including mobilization. Alternative full TRSSV replacement would have required workover rig ($1.8M and 45 days).

npt_breakdown.root_cause: NSTA approval process for barrier remediation plan required 37 days
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Maintain pre-approved barrier contingency plans with NSTA for faster response

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Insert valve equipment not immediately available, required fabrication
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Stock critical safety equipment (insert valves) on platform or in regional hub

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Required time for TRSSV lock-open and insert valve installation

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Insert valves provide rapid, cost-effective safety barrier restoration when TRSSVs fail - $175k vs $1.8M for full TRSSV replacement
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Insert valve technology now approved as first-line response for TRSSV failures across portfolio

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Lock-open tools essential for eliminating flow obstruction from failed TRSSV while maintaining well access
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Lock-open + insert valve approach now standard procedure, documented in well intervention playbook

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Slickline operations significantly faster and cheaper than workover rig mobilization (8 days vs 45 days)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Prioritize slickline-compatible solutions for all barrier interventions where feasible

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Regular TRSSV function testing critical for early failure detection - failure occurred during routine 6-month test
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Maintain 6-month TRSSV testing frequency, consider replacing TRSSVs >15 years old proactively

regulatory_notifications.approval_conditions: Install certified insert valve as primary barrier, function test to confirm closure, submit barrier verification report

equipment_history.failure_mode: Hydraulic actuator failure - valve failed to close

function_test_history.comments: Hydraulic pressure applied but no valve movement detected

metadata.notes: Demonstrates safety barrier failure response, insert valve technology, regulatory compliance process

sand_screen.failure_indicator: Sustained sand production detected - surface equipment erosion

objectives: Restore well integrity without full workover
Protect surface facilities from further erosion damage
intervention_history.operations_summary: Through-tubing expandable patch deployed via wireline to isolate 30m section of failed sand screen. Patch expanded to 4.75 inch ID creating new sand exclusion barrier. Post-intervention sand monitoring shows zero sand production. Production capacity reduced 12% due to restricted flow area vs. cost/benefit of full workover ($3.2M). Avoided complete facility shutdown risk from sand erosion.

npt_breakdown.npt_event: Emergency well shut-in due to sand production
npt_breakdown.root_cause: Wire-wrapped screen failure allowing sustained sand production - risk of surface equipment catastrophic failure
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Proactive screen integrity monitoring (sand detection systems), replace screens >15 years old in high-drawdown wells

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Wireline caliper tool stuck in accumulated sand fill
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Pre-intervention cleanout run to remove sand fill, avoid caliper deployment in high-sand environments without pre-cleaning

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Initial patch position 5m too shallow, required retrieval and redeployment
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Improved depth correlation using CCL (casing collar locator), dry-run positioning verification

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Through-tubing expandable patches provide viable alternative to costly full workovers for sand screen failures - $310k vs $3.2M
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Expandable patch technology approved for screen failures where 85%+ capacity acceptable

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Early sand detection systems critical for minimizing surface equipment damage - erosion damage cost $450k in flowline repairs
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Install acoustic sand detectors on all sand-risk wells, implement immediate shut-in protocol when sand detected

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Patch ID sizing must balance sand exclusion vs. production capacity - 4.75 inch ID provided excellent sand control but 12% capacity reduction
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Economic modeling to optimize patch ID selection, consider larger patches where feasible

hse_performance.comments: Near-miss: Sand erosion discovered in flowline bend before catastrophic failure

metadata.notes: Demonstrates sand control failure response, through-tubing patch technology

intervention_history.operations_summary: Coiled tubing deployed with heated chemical wax dissolver (xylene-based) and mechanical scraper tools. 300m section of complete wax blockage removed in stages using soak-and-scrape technique. Hot oil circulation program established for ongoing wax management.

npt_breakdown.root_cause: Paraffin wax precipitation due to cooling in tubing string - no preventive wax management program
npt_breakdown.prevention_recommendation: Hot oil circulation every 90 days, heated production system, chemical wax inhibitor injection

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Heated chemical dissolvers + mechanical scrapers deliver superior results vs either alone (85% vs ~50% capacity)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Combined approach mandatory for severe paraffin wax blockages

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Preventive hot oil programs cost-effective vs reactive interventions - $12k/quarter vs $395k reactive
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Hot oil circulation now mandatory for all wax-risk wells

metadata.notes: Demonstrates paraffin wax management, preventive vs reactive intervention economics

well_header.primary_issue: Compound failures: (1) TRSSV failed closed @ 2,100m, (2) Severe scale 4,200-4,500m, (3) Casing deformation @ 620m

scssv.failure_mode: Failed in closed position - blocking well access

objectives: Phase 1: Mill-out failed TRSSV and install insert valve
Phase 3: Deploy expandable casing patch at 620m
intervention_history.operations_summary: PLANNED - Three-phase campaign requiring workover rig due to TRSSV mill-out requirement. Estimated 45 days offshore operations. Phases must be executed sequentially due to well access constraints. Total estimated cost $2.85M with 28% contingency for compound-issue complexity.

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Multiple concurrent failures compound NPT costs exponentially - W666 demonstrates 3x cost vs sum of individual interventions
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Integrated multi-issue intervention planning essential, avoid sequential approach

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: W666 represents combination of all issues resolved individually in offset wells M-21, S-15, and F-11
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Proactive monitoring and preventive maintenance programs across portfolio to prevent compound-failure scenarios

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Well shut-in >3 years due to funding delays - cumulative production loss ($92.6M) far exceeds intervention cost ($2.85M)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Fast-track funding approval for well integrity interventions, economic penalty of delayed action severe

metadata.notes: Demonstrates compound-failure scenario, economic penalty of intervention delay, integrated planning requirements

well_header.key_lesson: Integrated multi-discipline campaigns compress timelines and maximize production uplift

objectives: Phase 1: TRSSV replacement + insert valve backup installation
Phase 3: Matrix acidization for near-wellbore stimulation
intervention_history.operations_summary: Three-phase integrated campaign executed over 85 days: (1) TRSSV replacement with new-generation valve + backup insert valve for redundancy, (2) 400m descaling campaign removing BaSO4 accumulation, (3) Matrix acidization treatment for formation damage remediation. Campaign compressed timeline by 40% vs. sequential approach (85 days vs 145 days). Production restored to 92% of original capacity, exceeding 85% target.

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Integrated multi-discipline campaigns deliver superior results vs sequential interventions - 40% timeline compression, 92% capacity restoration
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Integrated approach now portfolio-wide standard for multi-issue wells

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Comprehensive pre-intervention diagnostics enable precise intervention design - avoided unnecessary operations, optimized phase sequencing
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Invest in thorough diagnostics (wireline surveys, pressure monitoring, fluid sampling) before finalizing intervention plan

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: 48-day payback period demonstrates exceptional ROI - $4.25M investment generated $36.4M value (856% ROI)
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: S-77 success story used to justify similar integrated campaigns on wells W666, P-15, F-18

lessons_learned_structured.lesson: Proactive preventive maintenance programs dramatically reduce future NPT - S-77 maintained >90% uptime for 5+ years post-campaign
lessons_learned_structured.recommendation: Quarterly monitoring, annual scale inhibitor squeeze, 3-year TRSSV function test cycle now mandatory

hse_performance.comments: Best-in-class HSE performance - zero incidents over 85-day campaign

key_periods.comments: Production declined to 45% capacity - multiple issues

npt_costs.comments: Proactive intervention avoided catastrophic well failure

metadata.notes: PORTFOLIO SHOWCASE: S-77 demonstrates best-in-class integrated intervention approach, exceptional ROI, sustained performance through preventive maintenance

key_lessons_portfolio_wide.lesson: Proactive preventive maintenance delivers 10x ROI vs reactive interventions
key_lessons_portfolio_wide.evidence: S-15 scale inhibitor squeeze ($85k) prevented $420k reactive intervention

key_lessons_portfolio_wide.lesson: Integrated multi-discipline campaigns compress timelines 40% and maximize uplift
key_lessons_portfolio_wide.evidence: S-77 achieved 92% capacity restoration vs 65-75% typical for sequential approach

key_lessons_portfolio_wide.lesson: Rigless technologies (slickline, wireline, CT) reduce costs 80-90% vs workover rigs
key_lessons_portfolio_wide.evidence: F-11 insert valve $175k vs $1.8M TRSSV workover, C-08 patch $310k vs $3.2M workover

key_lessons_portfolio_wide.lesson: Funding delays for well integrity interventions create exponential cost growth
key_lessons_portfolio_wide.evidence: W666 3-year delay = $92.6M production loss vs $2.85M intervention cost (32x multiplier)

key_lessons_portfolio_wide.lesson: Comprehensive diagnostics essential for precise intervention design
key_lessons_portfolio_wide.evidence: Caliper logs, sand monitoring, pressure tests prevented misdiagnosis and wasted intervention spend

recommended_preventive_programs.npt_avoided_estimate: Prevents 45 days average shut-in per failure (F-11 case study)
Prevents $395k reactive wax removal (P-12 case study)
Early detection prevents compound-failure scenarios (W666 avoided)

data_quality_impact_on_ai.lessons_learned_training_value: Exceptional - structured data enables machine learning
missing_data_gaps: Production history pre-2018 for some wells (legacy data digitization required)
Equipment maintenance records pre-2015 (paper records require scanning)
Detailed geological models (seismic data integration pending)
